title: Trump defends Giuliani amid growing criminal investigation
text:
POLITICO reported earlier Friday that in addition to previously known probes by FBI agents and the U.S. Attorney’s Office in Manhattan, the Criminal Division of the Justice Department in Washington has taken an interest in Giuliani.

The involvement of the DOJ’s headquarters indicates the investigation is both broader and moving at a faster pace than previously understood.

Nevertheless, Trump remained firm in his defense of Giuliani, especially his work pursuing unsubstantiated allegations of corruption by the Bidens in Ukraine and of a conspiracy theory that Ukraine aided Democrats in the 2016 election.

“He looks for corruption wherever he goes. Everybody understands Ukraine has big problems in that regard,” Trump said.

Giuliani’s only public comment in recent days was a tweet Wednesday in which he wrote, “Everything I did was to discover evidence to defend my client against false charges.”

Further scrutiny befell Giuliani after two of his foreign-born associates were indicted on campaign finance charges over allegations of buying political influence on behalf of a Ukrainian government official and a Russian businessman, charges to which the two have since pleaded not guilty .

Still, as Congress continues to collect testimony on Trump and his allies’ efforts to leverage military and diplomatic support for politically motivated investigations from Ukraine, the president presented himself as unfazed.

“Rudy Giuliani is a fine man,” Trump concluded. “He was the greatest mayor in the history of New York, and he’s been one of the greatest crime fighters and corruption fighters. Rudy Giuliani is a good man.”
